trans-unit.source: Understanding Site to Azure Protection
trans-unit.target: Understanding Site to Azure Protection

trans-unit.source: Use this article to understand the technical concepts which helps you successfully install, configure, and manage Azure Site Recovery.
trans-unit.target: Use this article to understand the technical concepts which helps you successfully install, configure, and manage Azure Site Recovery.

trans-unit.source: This article describes the technical concepts which helps you successfully configure and manage Hyper-V site or VMM site to Azure protection using Azure Site Recovery.
trans-unit.target: This article describes the technical concepts which helps you successfully configure and manage Hyper-V site or VMM site to Azure protection using Azure Site Recovery.

trans-unit.source: As part of setting up DR between on-premises & Azure; Azure Site Recovery Provider needs to be downloaded and installed on the VMM server along with Azure Recovery Services Agent which needs to be installed on each Hyper-V host.
trans-unit.target: As part of setting up DR between on-premises & Azure; Azure Site Recovery Provider needs to be downloaded and installed on the VMM server along with Azure Recovery Services Agent which needs to be installed on each Hyper-V host.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>VMM Site Deployment for replication between on-premises & Azure</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>VMM Site Deployment for replication between on-premises & Azure</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V Site deployment is same as that of VMM Deployment – only difference being Provider & Agent gets installed on the Hyper-V host itself.
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V Site deployment is same as that of VMM Deployment – only difference being Provider & Agent gets installed on the Hyper-V host itself.

trans-unit.source: Once you protect a virtual machine from portal or on-premises, an ASR job named Enable Protection will be initiated and can be monitored under the JOBS tab.
trans-unit.target: Once you protect a virtual machine from portal or on-premises, an ASR job named Enable Protection will be initiated and can be monitored under the JOBS tab.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Troubleshoot on-premises Hyper-V issues</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Troubleshoot on-premises Hyper-V issues</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enable Protection job checks for the prerequisites before invoking CreateReplicationRelationship which creates replication to Azure using inputs configured during protection.
trans-unit.target: Enable Protection job checks for the prerequisites before invoking CreateReplicationRelationship which creates replication to Azure using inputs configured during protection.

trans-unit.source: Enable Protection job starts the initial replication from on-premises by invoking StartReplication which sends the virtual machine's virtual disks to Azure.
trans-unit.target: Enable Protection job starts the initial replication from on-premises by invoking StartReplication which sends the virtual machine's virtual disks to Azure.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Troubleshoot on-premises Hyper-V issues</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Troubleshoot on-premises Hyper-V issues</linkText>

trans-unit.source: A <linkText>Hyper-V VM snapshot</linkText><title></title> is taken when Initial Replication is triggered.
trans-unit.target: A <linkText>Hyper-V VM snapshot</linkText><title></title> is taken when Initial Replication is triggered.

trans-unit.source: Virtual hard disks are processed one by one till all the disks are uploaded to Azure.
trans-unit.target: Virtual hard disks are processed one by one till all the disks are uploaded to Azure.

trans-unit.source: This normally takes a while to complete based on the disk size and the bandwidth.
trans-unit.target: This normally takes a while to complete based on the disk size and the bandwidth.

trans-unit.source: Refer <linkText>How to manage on-premises to Azure protection network bandwidth usage</linkText><title></title> for optimizing your network usage.
trans-unit.target: Refer <linkText>How to manage on-premises to Azure protection network bandwidth usage</linkText><title></title> for optimizing your network usage.

trans-unit.source: Once initial replication completes Finalize protection on the virtual machine job configures the network and post-replication settings.
trans-unit.target: Once initial replication completes Finalize protection on the virtual machine job configures the network and post-replication settings.

trans-unit.source: While Initial Replication is in-progress all the changes to the disks gets tracked as mentioned in Delta Replication section below.
trans-unit.target: While Initial Replication is in-progress all the changes to the disks gets tracked as mentioned in Delta Replication section below.

trans-unit.source: Additional disk storage will be consumed for the snapshot and HRL files while Initial Replication is in-progress.
trans-unit.target: Additional disk storage will be consumed for the snapshot and HRL files while Initial Replication is in-progress.

trans-unit.source: On completion of an Initial Replication, Hyper-V VM snapshot will be deleted which results in merging data changes post Initial Replication to the parent disk.
trans-unit.target: On completion of an Initial Replication, Hyper-V VM snapshot will be deleted which results in merging data changes post Initial Replication to the parent disk.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Troubleshoot on-premises Hyper-V issues</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Troubleshoot on-premises Hyper-V issues</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V Replica Replication Tracker, which is part of the Hyper-V Replica Replication Engine, tracks the changes to a virtual hard disk as Hyper-V Replication Logs (*.hrl).
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V Replica Replication Tracker, which is part of the Hyper-V Replica Replication Engine, tracks the changes to a virtual hard disk as Hyper-V Replication Logs (*.hrl).

trans-unit.source: HRL files will be located in the same directory as of the associated disks.
trans-unit.target: HRL files will be located in the same directory as of the associated disks.

trans-unit.source: Each disk configured for replication will have an associated HRL file.
trans-unit.target: Each disk configured for replication will have an associated HRL file.

trans-unit.source: This log(s) is (are) sent to the customer's storage account after initial replication is complete.
trans-unit.target: This log(s) is (are) sent to the customer's storage account after initial replication is complete.

trans-unit.source: When a log is in transit to the Azure, the changes in the primary are tracked in another log file in the same directory.
trans-unit.target: When a log is in transit to the Azure, the changes in the primary are tracked in another log file in the same directory.

trans-unit.source: VM replication health during Initial Replication or Delta Replication can be monitored in the VM view as mentioned under <linkText>Monitor replication health for virtual machine</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: VM replication health during Initial Replication or Delta Replication can be monitored in the VM view as mentioned under <linkText>Monitor replication health for virtual machine</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: A virtual machine is marked for re-synchronization when both Delta Replication fails and Full Initial Replication is costly in terms of network bandwidth or the time it would take to complete a Full Initial Replication.
trans-unit.target: A virtual machine is marked for re-synchronization when both Delta Replication fails and Full Initial Replication is costly in terms of network bandwidth or the time it would take to complete a Full Initial Replication.

trans-unit.source: For example when HRL file-size piles up to 50% of the total disk size then the virtual machine is marked for re-synchronization.
trans-unit.target: For example when HRL file-size piles up to 50% of the total disk size then the virtual machine is marked for re-synchronization.

trans-unit.source: Re-synchronization minimizes the amount of data sent over the network by computing check-sums of the Source and Target virtual machine disks and sending only the differential.
trans-unit.target: Re-synchronization minimizes the amount of data sent over the network by computing check-sums of the Source and Target virtual machine disks and sending only the differential.

trans-unit.source: After re-synchronization completes, normal Delta Replication should resume.
trans-unit.target: After re-synchronization completes, normal Delta Replication should resume.

trans-unit.source: Re-synchronization can be resumed in the event of an outage (e.g. network outage, VMMS crash, etc.).
trans-unit.target: Re-synchronization can be resumed in the event of an outage (e.g. network outage, VMMS crash, etc.).

trans-unit.source: By default Automatically scheduled re-synchronization is configured during the non-office work hours.
trans-unit.target: By default Automatically scheduled re-synchronization is configured during the non-office work hours.

trans-unit.source: If the virtual machine needs to be re-synchronized manually, select the virtual machine from the portal and click RESYNCHRONIZE.
trans-unit.target: If the virtual machine needs to be re-synchronized manually, select the virtual machine from the portal and click RESYNCHRONIZE.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Troubleshoot on-premises Hyper-V issues</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Troubleshoot on-premises Hyper-V issues</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Re-synchronization uses a fixed-block chunking algorithm where Source and Target files are divided into fixed chunks; check-sum for each chunk are generated and then compared to determine which block(s) from the Source need to be applied to the Target.
trans-unit.target: Re-synchronization uses a fixed-block chunking algorithm where Source and Target files are divided into fixed chunks; check-sum for each chunk are generated and then compared to determine which block(s) from the Source need to be applied to the Target.

trans-unit.source: There is built-in retry logic when replication errors occur.
trans-unit.target: There is built-in retry logic when replication errors occur.

trans-unit.source: This can be classified into two categories as below.
trans-unit.target: This can be classified into two categories as below.

trans-unit.source: Category
trans-unit.target: Category

trans-unit.source: Scenarios
trans-unit.target: Scenarios

trans-unit.source: Non-Recoverable Error
trans-unit.target: Non-Recoverable Error

trans-unit.source: No retry will be attempted.
trans-unit.target: No retry will be attempted.

trans-unit.source: Virtual machine replication status will be shown as Critical and an administrator intervention is required.
trans-unit.target: Virtual machine replication status will be shown as Critical and an administrator intervention is required.

trans-unit.source:
Examples would include
  • A broken VHD chain
  • Replica virtual machine is in an invalid state
  • Network authentication error
  • Authorization Error
  • If a virtual machine isn't found in the case of a standalone Hyper-V server
trans-unit.target:
Examples would include
  • A broken VHD chain
  • Replica virtual machine is in an invalid state
  • Network authentication error
  • Authorization Error
  • If a virtual machine isn't found in the case of a standalone Hyper-V server

trans-unit.source: Recoverable Error
trans-unit.target: Recoverable Error

trans-unit.source: Retries occur every replication interval using exponentially backoff which increases the retry interval from the start of first attempt (1, 2, 4, 8, 10 minutes).
trans-unit.target: Retries occur every replication interval using exponentially backoff which increases the retry interval from the start of first attempt (1, 2, 4, 8, 10 minutes).

trans-unit.source: If an error persists, retry every 30 minutes.
trans-unit.target: If an error persists, retry every 30 minutes.

trans-unit.source:
Examples would include
  • Network Error
  • Low disk space
  • Low memory condition
trans-unit.target:
Examples would include
  • Network Error
  • Low disk space
  • Low memory condition
